meanings.definition: A person or thing that persuades.
meanings.sent1: The persuader convinced everyone to go to the park.
meanings.sent2: She used the persuader to change their minds about the movie choice.
meanings.sent3: The little dog became a master persuader when it wanted treats.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was a powerful persuader in getting people to agree with her.
meanings.sent5: The persuader's words echoed in their minds long after the conversation ended.

meanings.definition: A tool or device used to persuade.
meanings.sent1: He reached for the persuader to help with the stuck drawer.
meanings.sent2: The salesman's best persuader was his friendly demeanor.
meanings.sent3: The persuader in her hand was a magic wand for getting what she wanted.
meanings.sent4: The persuader in his toolbox was his secret weapon for fixing things.
meanings.sent5: The shiny persuader gleamed under the bright lights of the stage.

meanings.definition: A person who is skilled at persuading others.
meanings.sent1: The young girl was a natural persuader, always getting her way.
meanings.sent2: He was known as the office persuader for his ability to negotiate deals.
meanings.sent3: The persuader at the party had everyone laughing and agreeing with him.
meanings.sent4: She was a master persuader, able to convince even the toughest critics.
meanings.sent5: The persuader's charm was irresistible, drawing people in with ease.
